channel.title: Media on Voyager Internet Ltd.
channel.description: Recent content in Media on Voyager Internet Ltd.

item.title: Voyager Media Awards 2019
item.description: We rolled out the blue carpet again this year for the 2019 Voyager Media Awards!

item.title: New Zealand’s top news editors cast their predictions for this year’s biggest news stories still to come
item.description: The names of more than 280 finalists in the 2019 Voyager Media Awards have been released today after weeks of judging nearly 2000 entries.

item.title: Voyager Leads the Crusade for Faster Fibre in Christchurch
item.description: Voyager is one of the first Christchurch broadband providers to offer local residents twice the fibre speeds, for free, in partnership with local fibre company, Enable.

item.title: Finalists announced for Voyager Media Awards 2018
item.description: Finalists for the 2018 Voyager Media Awards have today been announced, celebrating the best of the best from across the country’s most well-established news outlets, growing independents and influential newcomers.

item.title: Top 3 IT Blunders of 2017
item.description: Top 3 IT Blunders of 2017 The now infamous guy who hit the missile button instead of clocking out in Hawaii yesterday got us thinking, what were the top 3 IT blunders of last year that will still keep us laughing (and cringing) all the way through 2018…

item.title: Voyager Internet new sponsor for national media awards
item.description: New Zealand internet provider Voyager will take over as naming-rights sponsor for the 2018 national media awards.

item.title: We've been highly commended for our customer service!
item.description: We’re rapt! On the 2ndof November, Voyager attended the Broadband Compare Awards in Auckland and we were stoked to be ‘highly commended’ for our commitment to customer service.

item.title: Voyager acquires leading local phone services company, conversant
item.description: Leading broadband and telecommunications provider Voyager Internet has enhanced its voice technology capabilities with the acquisition of leading local internet phone services company, Conversant.

item.title: Actrix bought by Voyager
item.description: Voyager Internet (Winner of the 2014 Deloitte Fast 50 as NZ’s fastest growing company) has announced that it is purchasing Wellington based Actrix, which was, in 1989, the first company to sell commercial Internet access in New Zealand.

item.title: Voyager - one of Deloitte's top 30 fastest growing tech companies in the whole Asia/Pacific!
item.description: Fifty-one New Zealand technology companies have been included in the 2014 Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Asia Pacific index, tying the record for Kiwi companies achieved in 2009 and outpacing last year’s 40 companies.

item.title: Voyager's NZ UFB rollout "on schedule and accelerating"!
item.description: Voyager Internet, recently recognised as New Zealand’s fastest growing business in the Deloitte Fast 50, has extended its UFB service rollout across the country, with founder and CEO Seeby Woodhouse eyeing further expansion by 2015.

item.title: Speed - it's in our DNA!
item.description: Ultra-fast growth puts Voyager in front! From 3News: Auckland-based Voyager Internet has been named the fastest-growing Kiwi company in this year’s Deloitte Fast 50 index.

item.title: We are the fastest!!!
item.description: And this is just the beginning… Only the end of the sky and your imagination is the limit of what we can do…

item.title: Voyager is Auckland's fastest growing tech company!
item.description: The “fastest” internet service provider Voyager Internet has been named Auckland and the Upper North Island’s fastest growing technology company, measured by the yardsticks set out by consultancy firm Deloitte Private.

item.title: .NZ Top Level Domains live from today!
item.description: Did you know that from today you can now register Internet Domain Names in NZ without the .

item.title: We're officially the fastest ISP in NZ
item.description: Voyager was the standout performer in the latest Independent TrueNet Broadband Monitoring Report, with our VDSL product being the fastest broadband service in the land, measuring an average 2.

item.title: Mayor Len Brown oversees opening of new core network
item.description: Press Release: Mayor Len Brown cuts ribbon on Voyager Internet’s new network node.

item.title: Voyager chooses Hawaiki for trans-Pacific cable
item.description: Auckland, 1 October 2013 – Zealand ISP Voyager has signed a letter of intent with submarine cable group Hawaiki Cable Limited, confirming its intention to acquire international bandwidth on the trans-Tasman and trans-Pacific segments of the Hawaiki submarine cable system.
